title: nbdev-hello-world
text:
I’m modifying the nbdev tutorial so that it can be run in Colab. It is a little bit of extra work to set up, but otherwise works about the same. You can edit notebooks easily in colab, and if everything is set up correctly, github actions will run the commands that are necessary to process the notebooks and turn the repo into a static site. But for some processing another notebook may be needed to run the nbdev commands (or you can use the existing notebook and run the nbdev commands in the terminal).
This file will become your README and also the index of your documentation. It is in https://github.com/abecode/nbdev-hello-world/blob/main/nbs/index.ipynb. It will eventually be processed and show up as the repo’s landing page/README.mdhttps://github.com/abecode/nbdev-hello-world, but it has to be processed first.

title: nbdev-hello-world
text:
Developer Guide
If you are new to using nbdev here are some useful pointers to get you started.

Install nbdev_hello_world in Development mode
# make sure nbdev_hello_world package is installed in development mode
$ pip install -e .

# make changes under nbs/ directory
# ...

# compile to have changes apply to nbdev_hello_world
$ nbdev_prepare

title: nbdev-hello-world
text:
Usage

Installation
Install latest from the GitHub repository:
$ pip install git+https://github.com/abecode/nbdev-hello-world.git
or from conda
$ conda install -c abecode nbdev_hello_world
or from pypi
$ pip install nbdev_hello_world


Documentation
Documentation can be found hosted on this GitHub repository’s pages. Additionally you can find package manager specific guidelines on conda and pypi respectively.

title: nbdev-hello-world
